section.title: Viewing PCI Resource Usage from the CLI
section.p: To view information about PCI interface resources for a provider network from the CLI, use the following command:
where providernet is the UUID of the provider network.

where
pci_pfs_configured
is the number of PCI passthrough interfaces attached to the provider network
pci_pfs_used
is the number of PCI passthrough interfaces allocated to instances
pci_vfs_configured
is the number of SR-IOV interfaces attached to the provider network
pci_vfs_used
is the number of SR-IOV interfaces allocated to instances

context.p: To view the information from the web administration interface, follow these steps:

step.cmd: From the left pane menu select Admin System Networks to display the Networks page.
Click the name of the provider network to open the Provider Network Overview page.

info.p: Details for the provider network are displayed, including any associated segmentation ranges and tenant networks.
